channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-7255] KV size metric went missing from StoreScanner.
item.description:
In trunk due to the metric refactor, at least the KV size metric went missing.
See this code in StoreScanner.java:


    } finally {

      if (cumulativeMetric > 0 && metric != null) {



      }

    }

Just an empty if statement, where the metric used to be collected.
item.summary: KV size metric went missing from StoreScanner.

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: Mind taking a looksee boss?
Making critical so we don't forget it. Seems like simple fix.

I tried doing this:


Index: hbase-server/src/main/java/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/regionserver/StoreScanner.java

===================================================================

--- hbase-server/src/main/java/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/regionserver/StoreScanner.java	(revision 1449898)

+++ hbase-server/src/main/java/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/regionserver/StoreScanner.java	(working copy)

@@ -468,6 +468,8 @@

       }

     } finally {

       if (cumulativeMetric > 0 && metric != null) {

+        RegionMetricsStorage.incrNumericMetric(this.metricNamePrefix + metric,

+          cumulativeMetric);

 

       }

     }

... but there is a whole metrics context missing. Need to get a lesson from Mr. Elliott Clark
Yeah things got a little more complex. I'll get this up before a 0.96 is imminent.

If I understand the current implementation correctly, a MetricsStoreSource should be added under hbase-hadoop-compat/src/main/java/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/regionserver and implementations would be added under:

./hbase-hadoop1-compat/src/main/java/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/regionserver/MetricsStoreSourceImpl.java
./hbase-hadoop2-compat/src/main/java/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/regionserver/MetricsStoreSourceImpl.java
I don't think that complexity is needed. I think we can add this metric to one of the other regionserver mbeans.
Picking this up now.
Adds get and scan sizes back per region.
I went with just a min/max/average on these. Let me know if you think that a full histogram is worth the added expense.

Is this right ?


+    regionScanNextKey = regionNamePrefix + MetricsRegionServerSource.GET_KEY;
Nope not at all nice catch.
I did a skim. Looks good to me Elliott Clark

+   * Update the count and sizes resultScanner.next()

The above sentence seems incomplete.

QA report didn't come back. Mind attaching patch again ?
Added more comments for ted.

-1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment
http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12577888/HBASE-7255-2.patch
against trunk revision .

+1 @author. The patch does not contain any @author tags.

I was able to reproduce the hanging test, TestHBase7051#testPutAndCheckAndPutInParallel, locally.

The stack trace I obtained was short. I didn't see what is directly related to the patch.

Will dig some more.
The hang is related. I have a fix, it's not a real world problem but the mocking in that test doesn't simulate a real hregion very well.

This message is automatically generated.
Looks good (after a quick look ). Interesting that you chose to do the calculation outside of the StoreScanner loop, seems cleaner (but at the same time it's another loop over all KVs in the row)
I pulled the size computation out to so that compactions don't pay the cost of computing the size at at all; additionally that cleans up the StoreScanner interface a lot.

So I had to move the key size computation into nextRaw as some scans (ones that aren't meta) were missing metrics.

So I added a test to make sure this isn't missed again.

This message is automatically generated.

The suffix is not needed or it is made in the newStat call?


-    regionGetKey = regionNamePrefix + MetricsRegionServerSource.GET_KEY + suffix;

-    regionGet = registry.getLongCounter(regionGetKey, 0l);



+    regionGetKey = regionNamePrefix + MetricsRegionServerSource.GET_KEY;

+    regionGet = registry.newStat(regionGetKey, "", OPS_SAMPLE_NAME, SIZE_VALUE_NAME);

Otherwise looks good to me Mr. Elliott.
Nope. The MetricsStat type keeps track of min/max/count so it adds the appropriate (NumOps, Min, Max) suffix on for each number.

Thanks for the review everyone.

Checked into trunk and 0.95

Integrated in HBase-TRUNK #4059 (See https://builds.apache.org/job/HBase-TRUNK/4059/)
HBASE-7255 KV size metric went missing from StoreScanner. (Revision 1467485)

Result = SUCCESS
